profiles:
Summary Specialties: Large scale systems, hands on coder, fantastic troubleshooter at time of stress, mentoring, leadership, execution oriented, relentless focus on scaling people and systems, transparency, get it done right. 
 
Engineer, technical lead, architect for the #1 News site from 1999 - 2009. Wrote code, write documentation, deploy software, train engineers, build teams, lead teams to withstand unprecedented news events in the world for 10 years. Including Sept 11th, Kathrina, 2008 US Elections, Michael Jackson death. Using my technical skills and leadership, Yahoo! News is the #1 news sites consistently beating CNN, MSNBC year over year. Lead a team of 1 in 1999 to a team of 26 engineers. 
 
Lead a small superstar level engineers to design and build the Yahoo Publishing Platform to support all of Yahoo Media's publishing, content storage and content management needs in 2009. The system allow for non-engineers to build and launch Yahoo sites faster than any Yahoo systems before. Yahoo News and 350+ sites in Yahoo migrated to this platform, reducing 10 years of tech debt. 
 
Created the role of the Solution Architect and lead the team of 6 very senior engineers to evangelize, train, replicate ourselves in order to move large teams of engineers and product teams to adopt Yahoo Publishing Platform. 
 
Mentor more than 8 engineers across different departments to work on career and organization growth. Many of them seek me out directly. 
 
I've demonstrated passion, results oriented, able to see things from multiple perspectives, self-aware, able to influence by example, creativity in everything I do at work. 
 
Technical: Perl, PHP, Apache, Highly Scalable Web Sites, MYSQL, UNIX

Some: Javascript, CSS, Objective C, C/C++ Experience Software Architect Yahoo November 2014  – Present (10 months) Sunnyvale, California Making my fellow Yahoo engineers more productive by building automation to manage our software and hardware infrastructure Restaurant Partner I Privé - Sushi ∙ Sake ∙ Spirits September 2014  – Present (1 year) Burlingame, CA - manage all digital infrastructure for the restaurant including POS, credit card payments, digital hiring efforts, digital marketing, online marketing, oversee menu design, Yelp, Seatme, Eat24, Facebook and LinkedIn. 
 
- backup for Stanley Chan, the managing partner when he is unavailable Engineering Lead, Media Developer Productivity Yahoo July 2013  – Present (2 years 2 months) San Francisco Bay Area My team's goals are to maximize developer, productivity, community, happiness, engineering excellence. 
 
Build a 1-liner setup tool so anyone at Yahoo can get rid of cut/paste documentation and bring up a developer environment in less than 30 minutes. The tool also tracks in real time how many success and failures. 
 
Spearhead an effort at Yahoo to start coding standards for Java, C, Javascript where it has never been done before. Part of the engineering standards committee to increase the productivity, engineering excellence for Yahoo 
 
Part of the committee to evangelize, start a bug cleansing day and write the definitive guide to clean out bugs in Yahoo Engineer Lead for Yahoo! Publishing Platform Developer Network Yahoo December 2011  – Present (3 years 9 months) Sunnyvale,CA I lead the engineering team called the Yahoo! Publishing Platform Developer Network. We scale up the number and productivity of engineers 
 
We build tools for developers to be happy and productive working on (YPP) 
 
Grow the community of engineers using YPP 
 
Train engineers working on YPP 
 
Specifically in this role: 
 
I piloted using GitHub internally at Yahoo! by building up support, installing it, piloting the program and getting engineers excited 
 
I trained 2 new college graduate new hires and became their people manager and they became productive and engaged engineers working on tools. 
 
I write tools to make developers more productive. 
 
I continue to grow the Expert mentoring program that I created in 2011 to mentor and grow the list of experts in YPP. Lead Solution Architect for Yahoo! Publishing Platform, Technical Yahoo! Yahoo December 2010  –  December 2011  (1 year 1 month) Sunnyvale, CA For a year, I was the lead for a group of 6 senior Solution Architects to help Yahoo! properties to adopt and move to Yahoo! Publishing Platform (internal codename: Lego). It's the content management system that Yahoo! uses to manage their media consumer experiences, like News and Sports and Finance. About 150 Yahoo! sites are powered by this platform. We ship twice a week to every one of those sites, globally. 
 
I help scale the number of people who knew how to onboard with the platform from 1 person, to 6 people, eventually to 50+ people by doing training, mentoring, peer mentoring, documentation, optimizing everything that I identified as bottlenecks. 
 
Created an initiative of Lego Experts mentoring program, where I first identify a set of existing experts, put in an Apache voting process, pair up trainers for 1 on 1 mentoring and a peer voting system to vote in new experts. It's been wildly successful, able to graduate new experts and a long waiting list of engineers. 
 
Mentored 4 engineers to advocate for them, help plan their career, find challenging projects. Most of them were promoted and immediately seek me out again for continue mentoring. 
 
Inspire transparency by leading by example for the community of 200+ engineers. Senior Software Engineer, Media Integration Team Yahoo 2009  –  September 2010  (1 year) Lead the design, prototype, documentation, evangelizing, advocate of a complete rebuild of the one of the #1 properties for Yahoo! Media to be global from the start, built on a cloud based storage, forward looking data layer, forward looking display capabilities. 
 
Lead a team of senior engineers to design prototype Yahoo!'s next generation content system. Work across 5+ teams in 4+ timezones, across the product, project, engineering groups to deliver a design and prototype that is leading to a first implementation. 
 
Presentations across the company to CTO, SVP, engineering leads, product leads, QA leads to communicate key decisions, design in order to move forward and get agreements. 
 
Able to influence different team leaders to come to agreement on moving forward. 
 
Mentor high potential engineers to grow influence and take on leaderships roles. 
 
Work well with unknowns, lead with enthusiasm, drive towards solutions Software Architect Yahoo! News Yahoo 2005  –  2009  (4 years) Provide technical leadership to a team of 20+ backend and frontend engineers to create, manage the largest news web site (news.yahoo.com) on the internet.  
 
* design and drive the launch of a new 4 layer architecture to handle enormous traffic spikes (up to 100 times normal traffic). challenges include identifying the need for an entire architecture stack in Yahoo, launching the first implementation, exercising the implementing during a real event 
 
* provide overall architectural direction for all components of the web site including ingestion, content management, editorial tools, web page serving, content distribution, content syndication 
 
* mentoring junior and senior engineers to grow in their technical skills and maturity in growing their own careers. I became actively seek out by multiple engineers to mentor them in their careers 
 
* actively communicate with product, technical leadership on future direction of the product 
 
* drive new initiatives across multiple functional groups 
 
* created and lead a new team in Bangalore in 2007 to rebuild the legacy Yahoo! Weather backend which distributed data to all Y! properties including Y! Mail, Y! Homepage, the largest audience in the world with 300+ million users 
 
* in 3 months, identified performance on frontend, backend of the architecture and increase performance of the system from one of the worst to one of the best in company. Was asked by the company to lead a roadshow of presentation of the case study, join part of a task force to help the company improve uptime and stability. 
 
* key driver one of the first adopters of a new technology stack in Yahoo! to add a reverse proxy layer, now 3 years later the technology stack becoming standard in Yahoo! Media 
 
* able to always remove roadblocks to how a team works together, remove technical roadblocks by helping in troubleshooting, identifying the correct approach, being and training the 'go to' person Software Engineer Yahoo May 1999  –  August 2005  (6 years 4 months) Primary Engineer for Yahoo! News 
http://news.yahoo.com/ Technical Lead Yahoo May 1999  –  2005  (6 years) One of 2 engineers in Yahoo! News in 1999. Redesigned and re-architected the backend, frontend as the business and demand grew in 2000, 2003, 2005. Became lead engineer for a team of approximately 28 engineers. Yahoo News became the #1 news site for many years. 
 
In the first 6 years, I was the primary engineer for all phases of the system as well providing operational support 24 x 7. Built everything from feed ingestion, data storage, CMS, tools for editors, automated ranking, sorting, clustering photos and stories, publishing, frontend serving, monitoring, aggregating stories. 
 
Created the idea and implemented the most-emailed stories in 2001. The featured was recognized by an article in New York Times as the first implementation of the idea. 
 
Create a company wide system for mail to friend, without any requirements to do so. The system was designed an implemented, evangelized and later adopted by 99% of all properties in Yahoo! globally in all countries where Yahoo! has a presence. 
 
Designed and implemented a system to distribute news content to Yahoo! Mail in a massively scalable way that works globally for properties like news, finance, sports, tech. Summary Web enthusiast with extensive experience designing and architecting high performance and scalable platforms (at Yahoo scale). TC39 member, and co-owner of ECMA-402. Mentor, speaker and trainer. Also interested in academic work and teaching. 
 
Roles at Yahoo: 
 
* Principal Engineer at Yahoo Presentation Technologies Group 
* Member of Ecma TC39 committee 
* Maintainer of FormatJS Project

Summary Viraj is a Senior Engineering Manager/Principal Engineer/Tech Lead for the iSearch (Intent Search) team at Yahoo! Search. During his time at Yahoo!, Viraj has worked on/built/launched several industry leading products including Yahoo! Knowledge Graph(Search Entity Graph), Quick Answers on Search Results Page, search clients (toolbars), email and Social networks (Yahoo! Mail/Imap) , high performance web destinations (Yahoo.com). 
 
Innovation areas include algorithms for inserting dynamic content in email protocols, search monetization, web browser manipulation and biometric security (cancelable biometrics). Filed 6 patents in the above areas. 
 
•	12+ experience in C/C++/Java. 
•	12+ years of experience in building scalable client-server architectures.  
• Experience developing with Hbase, Hadoop, Pig Latin, apache, experience with Ajax, JavaScript, html/css, perl on FreeBSD and Windows platforms. 
•	5+ years of experience in developing Firefox and IE clients with a user base of 200 million. 
•	Solid understanding of the business and customer fundamentals for a client/server web product 
•	Internationalization experience for web based products. 
•	Experience in working in a team and communicating with and leading large discussion groups. 
•	Self Starter with proven analytical, research skills. 
 
Have applied engineering and business acumen in not only identifying opportunities for monetizing products but also providing significantly improved user experiences. 
 
Passionate about innovating, developed ideas and algorithms that have made an impact on hundreds of millions of web users.  
 
Like working with smart people and have strong work ethics.

Summary Experience in architecture, strategy, design, development, implementation, and operations of very large internet infrastructure/systems and marketplace Summary Experience in architecture, strategy, design, development, implementation, and operations of very large internet infrastructure/systems and marketplace Experience in architecture, strategy, design, development, implementation, and operations of very large internet infrastructure/systems and marketplace Experience in architecture, strategy, design, development, implementation, and operations of very large internet infrastructure/systems and marketplace Experience Principal Software Engineer Yahoo Inc! September 2012  – Present (3 years) Presently working on Yahoo! Mail Web experience and monetization Software Developer xAd, Inc November 2011  –  August 2012  (10 months) Mobile Search and Display Advertising. Lead Software Engineer, Yahoo Guaranteed Display Advertising system v2.0 Yahoo! Inc August 2008  –  December 2011  (3 years 5 months) First engineer to join the GD 2.0 Serving system. Prototype, Design and build the Serving systems and algorithms for next generation of Yahoo!'s Guaranteed Display advertising platform (GD 2.0). 
 
* Ongoing Feature development for Yahoo's Next generation Display advertising serving system, in close collaboration with scientists, mathematicians, economists and research engineers from Yahoo! Research Labs and Applied sciences. The systems are build to handle Billions of Page views Per Day. 
 
* Built the first prototype for the GD2 Online Serving system, all the way from the first line of code for the first iteration of the production system. This system was launched in shadow mode in march 2009, taking tee'd off production traffic, for basic systemic/algorithmic analysis. The learnings were used in the next iteration of serving-systems development, which replaced the old system in may 2011 .  
 
* Built the core algorithmic components for Indexing and Search infrastructure used to retrieve matching Ads for a given user-visit/query/page-view, with sub-millisecond index-lookup-latencies on search over a corpus of over several hundred-thousand documents in a single partition. Augmented the existing Index Serving infrastructure to accommodate the newly developed core indexing infrastructure, and reliable transport support for GD 2.0. The work was based on the following papers:  
 
- "Efficiently Evaluating Complex Boolean Expressions", Marcus Fontoura, Suhas Sadanandan, Jayavel Shanmugasundaram, Sergei Vassilvitski, Erik Vee, Srihari Venkatesan, Jason Zien, SIGMOD 2010 
 
- "Indexing Boolean Expressions", Steven Whang, Chad Brower, Jayavel. Shanmugasundaram, Sergei Vassilvitskii, Erik Vee, VLDB 2009 
 
* Cross platform/Cross team initiatives related to indexing (for NonGuaranteed Display advertising, Supplyscaping etc) Tinkerer in the Display Advertising world Yahoo! Inc August 2008  –  November 2008  (4 months) Yahoo!'s Guaranteed Delivery "Classic" backend infrastructure, which has been running for several years. 
 
Before starting on building the next-generation of advertising system, it was important to understand the existing ad-serving system, and I started on this project. 
 
The "classic" adserving system currently handles (globally) the online-serving of all of Yahoo's Guranteed Ad inventory, and contributes to Billion+ $$ in revenue (much of Yahoo's display ad revenue).  
 
Figuring out and bug-fixing the core ad-selection and ad-scoring logic of the GD 1.0 adserver within 2 months of joining the team, amongst other enhancements and bug fixes. 
 
Helped the performance certification initiative by taking up performance testing and tuning of the GD 1.0 adserver for both Yahoo! Internal traffic (YAN) , and Yahoo Newspaper consortium (NC) traffic on the very first week of joining this team, and developed supporting scripts/tools for performance testing. The work helped towards adserver performance certification for for LZ 2.0 and 3.0 milestone-releases. Lead Software Engineer, Y! Alerts, Audience platform engineering Yahoo! Inc December 2007  –  August 2008  (9 months) Overall technical leadership for Yahoo! Alerts V2.0 infrastructure project for around 10 months, till its initial Launch. This was in addition to my responsibilities with the Y! Avatars project. 
 
Yahoo! Alerts is a publish-subscribe system, used widely within and outside the company.  
 
Within this infrastructure project, I developed the scheduling component and the delayed-alerts component.  
 
The scheduling component figures when to send what Alert, and to whom, once a document-match is confirmed,  
The delayed-alert component stored the information in case users have subscribed to once-a-day or aggregated feeds, instead of realtime, and triggered a send to the user, at the appropriate time) Lead Software Engineer, Y! Avatars, Audience platform engineering Yahoo! Inc April 2006  –  August 2008  (2 years 5 months) Took over the ownership and technical leadership (Architecture, design, feature development) of Y! Avatars project (backend and frontend). Built, mentored and trained a team of around 10 people including senior engineers, front end engineers, visual and interaction designers, and interfaced with business product managers and content product managers.  
 
We built and maintained the software end-to-end, including deployment to and operations of 200+ servers and Multiple Storage Filers, Akamai/CDN, and later transitioned the operations to a dedicated operations team 
 
The platform handled 300 Million+ views per day, including traffic from big properties like Yahoo! Mail, Yahoo Answers, Yahoo Messenger, and Yahoo Search results page. 
 
We grew the product from a 3.5Million$$ per year Yahoo! property to 10Million$$ per year property, scaled the platform to handle 50X the traffic it handled when we took over it, Added fault tolerance to the architecture, added redundancy, and released multiple features (including virtual world, and the "second most used" Messenger plugin).  
 
Scaling this project within a short duration of 2 months after taking ownership, was critical to the Yahoo! Answers launch, and the then Y! Search EVP Qi Lu was in direct interaction with Senior management of this project, to ensure its success. 
 
The backend components has challenges related scale and latency. The Server components we developed handled 15k+ requests/second/box, handling data for 60Million+ user-records partitioned and replicated over boxes distributed over many colos, and guaranteeing a 99.5% SLA of < 3 milliseconds.  
 
The system allowed users to select and combine "items" to create their own display-images (Users could select stuff from amongst a pool of ~7000, and ever/still-growing set of usable items) and this resulted in billions of possible unique combinations/display-images. Trading off storage costs with latency of combining at call-time, was another challenge. Lead Software Engineer, Y! EM Classifieds, Audience platform engineering Yahoo! Inc January 2007  –  September 2007  (9 months) Y! Classifieds version 2.0, launched in Y! Emerging Markets (Y! Singapore, India, Vietnam, Taiwan) 
 
Contributed to all areas of the project, and provided technical leadership to the backend team.  
 
This project was heavy on MySQL and "Vespa" (Vespa is an in-house searchbox solution/vertical search infrastructure, where we had to heavily tweak the parameters contributing to relevancy of documents and ranking of search results across multiple product-categories) Senior Software Engineer, Y! Briefcase 2.0, Audience platform engineering Yahoo! Inc December 2005  –  May 2006  (6 months) Built a fully functional prototype for Y! Briefcase version 2.0 (In approximately 4 months). Was part of a 2 member team which developed this software end-to-end.  
 
We also developed a Windows desktop client, exposing features for Yahoo! Briefcase, like automatic backup and restore of data, where you could configure the Folders you want to backup. The restores were check-pointed, and would restart from where it stopped, if you disconnected and reconnected later on.  
 
The product was demo'ed to the then Yahoo! COO, Dan Rosensweig, who was evaluating various strategic areas to invest in.  
(Unfortunately, due to perceived storage costs at that time -- the project didn't get funding :). This was around the time when Gmail had just started ridiculing the whole storage-game. ) 
 
(In this project, we implemented features exposed by the then-famous idrive.com. Recently, companies like mozy.com have exposed similar features) Senior Software Engineer, Y! Message Boards 2.0, Audience platform engineering Yahoo! Inc December 2005  –  April 2006  (5 months) Y! Message boards 2.0 infrastructure project. 
 
(I contributed to this project, while I was also owning the Y! polls 2.0 platform) 
 
Contributed to feature development and enhancements. Also performance tuned the infrastructure (around mysql database backend, and freebsd tcp stack tuning) Senior Software Engineer, Y! Polls 2.0, Audience platform engineering Yahoo! Inc April 2004  –  April 2006  (2 years 1 month) Y! Polls Platform version 2.0, revamping Yahoo's Polls infrastructure to scale to 100Million+ page views per day, and 10M+ writes per day, handling traffic from Y! Finance, Y! sports and Y! News Frontpages (amongst the 35+ Yahoo properties which used this system). This system had a global deployment, with independent setups for multiple geographies (US, Singapore, Latin America, China). The Backend infrastructure was written in C++, with MySQL database backend, and PHP for Templating. One of the first projects at Yahoo! to be built on top of MySQL backend.  
 
Apart from the core backend, I also worked on a unified administration/management tool for this system, through which content producers could create and schedule quizzes/polls for various Yahoo properties, across geographies. (Implementing the admin tool gave me some UI development exposure early on) 
 
Worked mostly as a single man army for the duration of this platform project, architecting, designing, maintaining and deploying, and customer interfacing for 2 years. 
 
 
During the duration of this project, I also got an opportunity to train some of Yahoo's Master Oracle DBAs, who were new to the MySQL world ;-) (This was mostly around MySQL configuration for InnoDB engine tweaked for performance, Replication chaining, and selective replication across multiple colos) Software Engineer, Y! Messenger Server Core Yahoo Inc! June 2003  –  March 2004  (10 months) Y! Messenger Server Core. Part of a (then) 10 member team which developed, maintained and deployed all of Y! Instant Messenger backend. 
 
Contributed to new-feature development related to online presence indication infrastructure, online file transfer, realtime QOS statistics gathering, and performance testing and bug-fixing in other Core server components related to user and event management. The system allowed users to select and combine "items" to create their own display-images (Users could select stuff from amongst a pool of ~7000, and ever/still-growing set of usable items) and this resulted in billions of possible unique combinations/display-images. About the product  
- IntoNow introduces a true TV companion experience with synchronized news headlines, in-depth sports stats, and tweets from your favorite actors. 
- IntoNow makes engaging with your friends around your favorite television shows easy and fun. Just tap the green button when you’re watching, and IntoNow will identify the show, right down to the episode. Once identified it’s easy to share with your friends on Twitter or Facebook. 
 
My responsibilities 
- Involved in the redesign of backend infrastructure for high scalability  
- Designed a framework for write through cache solution. This helps in faster reads from the cache and reduces the load on primary storage 
- Working on the “News Feed Aggregation” for various actions taken by users on the intonow app and how it is propagated to his network of friends for better user engagement. 
- Designed the activity feed(friends, everyone, onair) for the Intonow app. The new design reduced the latency multi-folds with reads happening from cache instead of the primary store 
- Designed and implemented the user notification system for the IntoNow app. The new design uses write-fan logic for cache and primary store as notifications were sent a list of friends involved in a particular activity. 
- Designed and implemented the FriendsList for fetching an user’s friends information from cache and updating the information when a friend is added or deleted. 
- Unit tests and Scenario tests for all backend apis. Software Engineer Yahoo! December 2010  –  October 2011  (11 months) Sunnyvale Y! Universal Header  
- Designed and implemented the back-end for the "Persistent header" component for Universal head.   
- Designed and implemented the Lego wrapper for the universal header component which helped in pushing the universal header to properties that were using Lego components.  
- Added new features to  the UCS publishing system which was used for configuring the Universal Header for different properties and vendors.  
- Successfully onboarded many properties from across the globe to use UH2.0 and provided support to them when they had issues with Universal Header 
 
Bubbles Iphone App 
Bubbles was a spatial social networking app which was created as an experiment at Yahoo. The user could create bubbles of a certain circumference and invite others to join the bubble. Once inside the bubble , the users could share pictures, have discussions and exchange information. However the users have to be present at the same location and the same time as the bubble to interact with it. Hence if the bubble is created in Sunnyvale for an event from 3pm to 4pm, then a person in San Francisco cannot participate in it. 
 
My Responsibilities - 
- Designed and developed the Iphone App for "Bubbles"  
- Wrote the framework for Request management used by various screens 
- Wrote the "Pull to Refresh" library  
- Implemented "Custom Cells" for various tables based of different needs 
- Implemented the Asynchronous Image loading library to load images in background threads and not holding up the main thread. 
 
- Implemented the Backend API to fetch activities in a Bubble. 
- Designed and Implemented the Auto-creation of "Bubbles" based on Events feed Software Engineer Yahoo! October 2009  –  November 2010  (1 year 2 months) Worked on Integration of Facebook, Twitter and Zynga with Yahoo Updates.

Summary Vaibhav is a Software Engineer with 7 years of experience in architecture, design and development of web applications and distributed systems.I worked on a number of projects in leading Internet companies contributing design, code on both front-end and back-end components built on the state of the art technologies in distributed environments. Experienced in designing and implementing large-scale systems on data sets of millions of users. 
 
• Strong analysis, architecture and design skills using Java, PHP, C++ and Design Patterns.  
• Hands on experience in designing and developing highly scalable web applications and multi-tiered systems 
• Design and implement core back-end software components 
• A quick learner. Code in a variety of languages(Java, PHP, C++, JavaScript etc.) but worked primarily on Java/PHP.  
• Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of various system resources.  
• Have a sound understanding of building highly scalable and distributed systems at Yahoo scale.  
• Have a sound understanding of full stack development ( Front end and Backend). Worked on different full stack technologies at Yahoo.	 
• Collaborate, lead and mentor technical team for different projects.  
• Experience with file systems, concurrency, multithreading, server architectures, and distributed system 
• Worked on Machine Learning based approaches for building vertical search and recommendation. 
• Solid understanding of Computer Science fundamentals 
 
Specialties: Java, PHP, SQL, jQuery, YUI, REST, JSON, JavaScript, Ant, Tomcat, Vertical Search, Key-Value database, Hadoop and Map Reduce. Summary Hello, thanks for taking a look at my LinkedIn profile. 
 
Here's how I'd describe my professional experience and goals. 
 
I enjoy creating and maintaining web-based tools to make the jobs of engineers, and non-engineers alike, easier. I've created content management systems, click-through-rate (CTR) stats reports, automated feed processing scripts using PHP, MySQL, Perl and Apache. I have been coming up to speed on professional frontend development using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to make desktop-like applications. I'd like to do more. 
 
In contrast to prototypical engineers who primarily hone their "hard" technical skills, I like to use and develop my "soft" skills as well. I communicate effectively with feature-crazed product managers, stressed-out project managers, detail-oriented QA teams, and relevancy-seeking editors. I seek to understand what they want so that I can give them what they need with the goal of delighting them in the process. Oh, and I love to write thorough twiki pages, it's the only way to write living docs.  
 
And finally, I'd like to say that I love to work at Internet companies. I enjoy the sprints of work, the variety of co-workers national and international, and the direct impact on people's lives online and offline. 
 
Thanks,
